intro: Serjania subdentata f. subrepandodentata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved serjania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, narrow leaves with finely serrated margins. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in racemes, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, well-drained soils.
